contextId.information: "they looked intently" or "they looked carefully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"began to speak" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom that means "take a breath" or "breathe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This idiom means to become self-confident or proud. AT: "If I become proud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
This is an idiom meaning "Be quiet" or "Stop talking." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Call someone to mind is an idiom meaning to think about him.  AT: "and then think about me" or "and then remember me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: and then call me to mind

contextId.information: This word is used here to draw Job's attention to what is said next. AT: "Listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "I will explain to you" or "I will make it clear to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "darkness" is a metaphor for trouble or misfortune. AT: "escape misfortune" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "glares at me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "will continue to live in a righteous way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "My time is past" or "My life is over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
To "look at" something a certain way means to "think" of it that way. AT: "I think of Sheol as my home" or "I now consider Sheol my home" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: I look at Sheol as my home

contextId.information: The phrase "These ten times" refers to the way that the friends have completely rebuked Job. AT: "You have completely reproached me" or "You have reproached me many times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: These ten times you have reproached me

contextId.information: The word for "milk" may mean "fat." Either rendering means he is well-fed. AT: "His body if full of fat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: His body is full of milk

contextId.information: To lay a treasure in the dust is to treat it as unimportant. AT: "Consider your riches to be as unimportant as dust" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Lay your treasure down in the dust

contextId.information: Job speaks of his unanswered complaint against God as if it was a bitter taste in his mouth. AT: "my unanswered complaint is as bad as bitter food in my mouth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
A person whose heart is weak is a person who is timid or fearful. AT: "made me afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Elihu uses this word here to draw the mens' attention to what he says next. AT: "Listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Elihu uses this word here to draw Job's attention to what he says next. AT: "Listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "man from dying and ... he keeps him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Elihu uses this word here as an idiom to draw Job's attention to what he says next. AT: "Listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This speaks of God destroying these men as if he actually broke their bodies into pieces. AT: "He destroys mighty men" or "He destroys important people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: He breaks mighty men into pieces

contextId.information: Meat that had plenty of fat on it was a sign of prosperity because the animals were healthy and well-fed. AT: "the very best food" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This means he flies upward. AT: "flies up into the sky" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
